page.title: 05The Tercentenary Celebration
page.content: 1985 is a very special year for Wigtowns'{local history .}It is the year in which the Tercentenary of the Wigtown Martyrs is celebrated.The Martyrs were drowned in Wigtown Bay on May 11th 1685 for failing to take the oath of abjuration. The town had organised several events to commerate this{martyrdom}. One of the main events was an{open-air {service}which took place at the edge of the bay. At this service, wreaths were placed at the stakes which marked the spot where the two martyrs were drowned. The moderator of the Church of Scotland was present at this service, as were 200/300 members of the public. The Church of Scotland had its own service to commerate this event.
